match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 48 runs (D/L method)

image.caption: General view, St George's Park, Port Elizabeth
image.longCaption: General view, St George's Park, Port Elizabeth

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy not out 71 (72b 2x4 1x6 124m) SR: 98.61

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla run out (Kohli/†Dhoni) 64 (69b 8x4 0x6 93m) SR: 92.75

dismissalComment.html: What a poor judgement for the second run. Greed! It was a mis-timed pull shot, the ball rolled away towards short fine-leg region. The slip fielder turned and rushed back. For some reason, Amla decided to turn back for the second run and was never in the frame when Dhoni collected the throw and broke the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Yuvraj walks quietly towards his team-mates! It turned away from the off stump line and Van Wyk stabbed it low to the right of lone slip fielder Kohli, who swoops forward to pouch it

Spun and gone! It drifted in round the stumps, lands on the off and middle line, and turned away. AB lunged forward to defend.  Dhoni took the 'catch' and broke the stumps in a flash. Simon Taufel, the umpire at the bowler's end, gave it out. So I reckon there was an edge. Replays in: Snicko shows there was no edge but he is stumped! Given out caught, of course

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Stumped! floated outside the off stump line, Botha goes for the sweep, misses and also drags the back foot outside the crease. Dhoni, as ever, doesn't take his hands back after collecting. He collects and immediately moves his hands forward to break the stumps. He knew immediately that he had got his man. Third umpire confirms it

headshotImage.caption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan takes a smart catch! Smith went down the track and flat batted it to right of mid-off where Harbhajan moved swiftly and lunged out to take a sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla run out (Kohli/†Dhoni) 64 (69b 8x4 0x6 93m) SR: 92.75

dismissalComment.html: What a poor judgement for the second run. Greed! It was a mis-timed pull shot, the ball rolled away towards short fine-leg region. The slip fielder turned and rushed back. For some reason, Amla decided to turn back for the second run and was never in the frame when Dhoni collected the throw and broke the stumps

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Spun and gone! It drifted in round the stumps, lands on the off and middle line, and turned away. AB lunged forward to defend.  Dhoni took the 'catch' and broke the stumps in a flash. Simon Taufel, the umpire at the bowler's end, gave it out. So I reckon there was an edge. Replays in: Snicko shows there was no edge but he is stumped! Given out caught, of course

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Kohli/†Dhoni) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: What is happening out there? Another poor judgement! It was pushed  towards square-leg and he rushed across for the non-existent run. Virat moved to his left, picked it up and fired a  hit at the striker's end. du Plessis had turned back but he couldn't get back in time

headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson run out (Pathan/Harbhajan Singh) 31 (35b 3x4 0x6 39m) SR: 88.57

dismissalComment.html: driven to Yusuf at extra cover and there is a terrible mix-up. Yusuf fires the throw to Harbhajan. Duminy had rushed across and Peterson wasn't interested but decides to get across. Harbhajan dislodges the bails by accident just as he was about to collect the throw. He then uprooted the stumps. Peterson sacrificed his wicket there

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli not out 87 (92b 7x4 2x6 126m) SR: 94.56

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina st †de Villiers b Peterson 20 (36b 0x4 0x6 41m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: stumped, a wicket just when it appeared they were recovering well, it went on straight from Peterson, Raina took a couple of steps down the track, it was short outside off, was beaten in flight, then tried to play for the turn and dab to the off side but the ball didn't turn in as much as he hoped and de Villiers did a neat job behind the stumps, the pressure is back on now

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rohit fails. Again. It was yet another delivery that was slanted across him outside off and Rohit cuts it straight to backward point.

headshotImage.caption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Trapped! Lonwabo takes out his second victim. It was a slightly slower one, landed full in length around off and moved in. Parthiv fell over a touch on that front foot and tried to waft across the line and missed. It would have taken out the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: stumped, a wicket just when it appeared they were recovering well, it went on straight from Peterson, Raina took a couple of steps down the track, it was short outside off, was beaten in flight, then tried to play for the turn and dab to the off side but the ball didn't turn in as much as he hoped and de Villiers did a neat job behind the stumps, the pressure is back on now

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Soft dismissal! It was a delivery outside off that stopped a touch on Dhoni who ended up checking his intended punch shot , and pushed the ball straight to short extra cover! Gone! He trudges back to the hut.

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Duminy b Tsotsobe 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Rohit fails. Again. It was yet another delivery that was slanted across him outside off and Rohit cuts it straight to backward point.

headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Smith b Botha 12 (20b 1x4 1x6 22m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Smith takes a lovely catch! Yuvraj went for the paddle sweep but didn't connect well. The ball lobbed towards leg gully. Smith rushed to his right from slips and the ball was dying on him but he dived full stretch to pouch it inches off the turf

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c †de Villiers b Morkel 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Morne takes out Yusuf with a superb delivery. It was full in length just outside off and seamed away at the last instant. Yusuf stumbled forward, late, and had a poke at it. He was trying to waft it to the on side! Fatal. Edge and gone! Morne roars!

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: on the middle and leg, wristed past square-leg region

commentPostTextItems.html: Dhoni: "They were scoring at a healthy pace. And that meant if they batted for 50 overs, they will get to a good total.. And that's what happened. I tried the fast bowlers, spinners, part-timers but things don't go your way always. We would have fancied something around 240. Virat is a big positive. He has batted at no. 3 and carried innings through.The middle order hasn't clicked. Not only for us but also for South Africa. The team that handles pressure better will win on Sunday."

Man of the match is JP Duminy "Just wanted to take it to end as possible. I thought we had a defendable target at the end. It all worked out quite nicely. When we got to 45 overs, we thought 250 would be a good result."

Smith: We started well today. We had a few moments where our brains didn't work but we showed a lot of skill and determination to recover. We knew anything around 240 would be good. Excellent effort from Duminy and the rest. We have done well with the ball in this series. We have generally fielded well. The intensity has been good. We are excited to go to Pretoria. The teams have been trading blows for 2 months now and it has been a competitive series.:
To read the Bulletin by Sid click here.
That's it from us. Good bye and good luck.

Sundar: "Thunderstorms forecast in Centurion?? Great! Will we ever get to know which is the better team out of these two? Every series between these two seems to end in a draw. Has to be a jinx. I seriously hope it is not an India vs SA world cup final. I am sure it will rain in Mumbai for two days and these teams will have to share the trophy."
10.40 Game called off. South Africa win by 48 runs. So 2-2 and we go to decider on Sunday. Apparently, 90% chance of thunderstorms in Centurion on Sunday
10.33 pm: They will decide at 10.45 pm whether to continue with the game or not.
10.17 pm More rain. and they are coming off again. And now for every four minutes, they will lose an over.

commentTextItems.html: leans forward to defend it back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: Raining again!

commentTextItems.html: quicker, turned to Smith at short fine-leg

commentPreTextItems.html: And more news: India will get four overs of Batting Powerplay

commentTextItems.html: top edges the paddle sweep and they rush across for a quick single to short fine-leg
gets back to deflect it to midwicket
around the off stump line, worked wide of midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: pushes it to covers, wants a single but Harbhajan sends him back in time

commentPreTextItems.html: Target is 260. India need 123 more from 87 balls. .

commentTextItems.html: full in length, on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
stays back to clip it past square-leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Target is 260. India need 123 more from 87 balls.
South Africans on the field, stumps being erected. Kohli and Harbhajan walk out
10.01 pm It was just a drizzle, and seems to have passed. so we might still be on for 2210 resumption, can't be sure, though
9.59 pm More rain! Aargh.
9.56 pm The game to start at 10.10 pm. Four overs lost. We will let you know the exact target when we get to know. We think it should be 258. No official word yet.

Preet Paul: "Virat seems to be playing in a totally different place - he has oodles of talent and has been in rich vein of form recently. He exudes confidence, his body language is very positive! I hope he is in the starting XI in the World Cup ahead of Yuvi and Raina."
For those wondering, the D/L par score is 187, and India are 50 runs behind. We should have play anyway soon.
9.49 pm: Pitch is still covered, they have removed all other covers. Not raining at the moment, though
9.39 pm Covers coming off now. Inspection around the corner. at 9.50 pm
9.34 pm: Umpires get on to the field. Drizzling still. And the covers are on.
9.20 pm: It's still raining. They will wait for an hour (from the moment game stopped) before they start reducing the overs. We will back in a short while as soon as we get any further updates.
8.52 pm: It's raining now The covers come on. The players rush to the pavilion.

commentPreTextItems.html: There is a light drizzle out there

commentTextItems.html: Swat-whack! It was a full delivery around the middle stump line and he dragged it with his bottom-hand through wide midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Ameya: "@Sameer: Its not Dhoni's Last innings under pressure. 67 was made playing for a lost cause, it wont count. I probably don't remember any such innings in distant past."

commentTextItems.html: stays back to punch it to mid-on
turns from the off stump line, fuller, Harbhajan squeezes it to point

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: turns away from the off stump, Harbhajan gets forward to push it quietly to the off
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
moves forward to drive to long-off
gets back to cut it to sweeper cover
leans forward to block it
pushes it wider outside off, left alone

commentTextItems.html: extra bounce outside off and Harbhajan stabs it wide of the slip fielder

commentPreTextItems.html: Sameer: "The last time dhoni played a significant role was when he scored 67 against Srilanka in dambula aug 2010. Wonder when is the next."

commentTextItems.html: gets back to defend it back down the track

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan takes a smart catch! Smith went down the track and flat batted it to right of mid-off where Harbhajan moved swiftly and lunged out to take a sharp catch

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Yuvraj walks quietly towards his team-mates! It turned away from the off stump line and Van Wyk stabbed it low to the right of lone slip fielder Kohli, who swoops forward to pouch it

Spun and gone! It drifted in round the stumps, lands on the off and middle line, and turned away. AB lunged forward to defend.  Dhoni took the 'catch' and broke the stumps in a flash. Simon Taufel, the umpire at the bowler's end, gave it out. So I reckon there was an edge. Replays in: Snicko shows there was no edge but he is stumped! Given out caught, of course

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Stumped! floated outside the off stump line, Botha goes for the sweep, misses and also drags the back foot outside the crease. Dhoni, as ever, doesn't take his hands back after collecting. He collects and immediately moves his hands forward to break the stumps. He knew immediately that he had got his man. Third umpire confirms it

dismissalComment.html: Harbhajan takes a smart catch! Smith went down the track and flat batted it to right of mid-off where Harbhajan moved swiftly and lunged out to take a sharp catch

headshotImage.caption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Morne van Wyk player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Morne van Wyk c Kohli b Yuvraj Singh 15 (22b 1x4 0x6 35m) SR: 68.18

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Yuvraj walks quietly towards his team-mates! It turned away from the off stump line and Van Wyk stabbed it low to the right of lone slip fielder Kohli, who swoops forward to pouch it

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla run out (Kohli/†Dhoni) 64 (69b 8x4 0x6 93m) SR: 92.75

dismissalComment.html: What a poor judgement for the second run. Greed! It was a mis-timed pull shot, the ball rolled away towards short fine-leg region. The slip fielder turned and rushed back. For some reason, Amla decided to turn back for the second run and was never in the frame when Dhoni collected the throw and broke the stumps

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Spun and gone! It drifted in round the stumps, lands on the off and middle line, and turned away. AB lunged forward to defend.  Dhoni took the 'catch' and broke the stumps in a flash. Simon Taufel, the umpire at the bowler's end, gave it out. So I reckon there was an edge. Replays in: Snicko shows there was no edge but he is stumped! Given out caught, of course

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Kohli/†Dhoni) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: What is happening out there? Another poor judgement! It was pushed  towards square-leg and he rushed across for the non-existent run. Virat moved to his left, picked it up and fired a  hit at the striker's end. du Plessis had turned back but he couldn't get back in time

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johan Botha st †Dhoni b Yuvraj Singh 44 (59b 3x4 0x6 59m) SR: 74.57

dismissalComment.html: Stumped! floated outside the off stump line, Botha goes for the sweep, misses and also drags the back foot outside the crease. Dhoni, as ever, doesn't take his hands back after collecting. He collects and immediately moves his hands forward to break the stumps. He knew immediately that he had got his man. Third umpire confirms it

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson run out (Pathan/Harbhajan Singh) 31 (35b 3x4 0x6 39m) SR: 88.57

dismissalComment.html: driven to Yusuf at extra cover and there is a terrible mix-up. Yusuf fires the throw to Harbhajan. Duminy had rushed across and Peterson wasn't interested but decides to get across. Harbhajan dislodges the bails by accident just as he was about to collect the throw. He then uprooted the stumps. Peterson sacrificed his wicket there

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Duminy b Tsotsobe 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Rohit fails. Again. It was yet another delivery that was slanted across him outside off and Rohit cuts it straight to backward point.

headshotImage.caption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Parthiv Patel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Parthiv Patel lbw b Tsotsobe 11 (24b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 45.83

dismissalComment.html: Trapped! Lonwabo takes out his second victim. It was a slightly slower one, landed full in length around off and moved in. Parthiv fell over a touch on that front foot and tried to waft across the line and missed. It would have taken out the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli not out 87 (92b 7x4 2x6 126m) SR: 94.56

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Smith b Botha 12 (20b 1x4 1x6 22m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Smith takes a lovely catch! Yuvraj went for the paddle sweep but didn't connect well. The ball lobbed towards leg gully. Smith rushed to his right from slips and the ball was dying on him but he dived full stretch to pouch it inches off the turf

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina st †de Villiers b Peterson 20 (36b 0x4 0x6 41m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: stumped, a wicket just when it appeared they were recovering well, it went on straight from Peterson, Raina took a couple of steps down the track, it was short outside off, was beaten in flight, then tried to play for the turn and dab to the off side but the ball didn't turn in as much as he hoped and de Villiers did a neat job behind the stumps, the pressure is back on now

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c du Plessis b Peterson 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Soft dismissal! It was a delivery outside off that stopped a touch on Dhoni who ended up checking his intended punch shot , and pushed the ball straight to short extra cover! Gone! He trudges back to the hut.

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yusuf Pathan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yusuf Pathan c †de Villiers b Morkel 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Morne takes out Yusuf with a superb delivery. It was full in length just outside off and seamed away at the last instant. Yusuf stumbled forward, late, and had a poke at it. He was trying to waft it to the on side! Fatal. Edge and gone! Morne roars!

headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh not out 3 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 37.5

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 54 runs, 0 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 9.1 overs (57 balls), Extras 2
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 57 balls (HM Amla 33, GC Smith 16, Ex 2)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 22 runs, 1 wicket)
HM Amla: 50 off 53 balls (8 x 4)
Drinks: South Africa - 86/1 in 16.0 overs (HM Amla 54, MN van Wyk 5)
South Africa: 100 runs in 18.3 overs (113 balls), Extras 9
South Africa: 150 runs in 29.5 overs (181 balls), Extras 11
Drinks: South Africa - 164/5 in 33.0 overs (JP Duminy 26, J Botha 26)
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (JP Duminy 22, J Botha 29, Ex 0)
South Africa: 200 runs in 40.4 overs (246 balls), Extras 12
Parthiv Patel kept wickets for Dhoni from 45th over
Powerplay 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0 (Batting side - 45 runs, 1 wicket)
JP Duminy: 50 off 61 balls (2 x 4)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (JP Duminy 23, RJ Peterson 27, Ex 0)
South Africa: 250 runs in 48.2 overs (292 balls), Extras 13
Innings Break: South Africa - 265/7 in 50.0 overs (JP Duminy 71, DW Steyn 4)
India innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 32 runs, 2 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 17 runs, 1 wicket)
India: 50 runs in 15.1 overs (91 balls), Extras 0
Drinks: India - 52/3 in 17.0 overs (V Kohli 26, SK Raina 2)
V Kohli: 50 off 67 balls (5 x 4)
India: 100 runs in 25.1 overs (151 balls), Extras 3
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 61 balls (V Kohli 30, SK Raina 18, Ex 3)
Rain: India - 137/6 in 31.3 overs (V Kohli 83, Harbhajan Singh 2)
4 overs lost due to rain, match is reduced to 46 overs and the target is 260
Rain: India - 142/6 in 32.5 overs (V Kohli 87, Harbhajan Singh 3)

stories.title: South Africa v India, 2010-11
stories.subTitle: 4th ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fourth ODI, South Africa v India, 2010-11

stories.title: Duminy is the real thing
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v India: Duminy is the real thing
stories.summary: JP Duminy's second successive half-century, both coming when South Africa were on the back foot, proves he is ready to take on responsibility in the middle order
stories.byline: Sidharth Monga at St George's Park

image.caption: Johan Botha and JP Duminy took South Africa to 265
image.longCaption: Johan Botha and JP Duminy took South Africa to 265, South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth, January 21, 2011

stories.title: Duminy stars in series-levelling win
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v India: JP Duminy stars in series-levelling win
stories.summary: JP Duminy orchestrated a fightback which hauled South Africa to a challenging total before India's batsmen, barring Virat Kohli, folded on a sluggish Port Elizabeth pitch

image.caption: Virat Kohli lofts on his way to a half-century
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli lofts on his way to a half-century, South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth, January 21, 2011

stories.title: 'Harbhajan is bowling as well as he has in his career' - Dhoni
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v India: 'Harbhajan is bowling as well as he has in his career' - Dhoni
stories.summary: India captain MS Dhoni says the performance of Harbhajan Singh and the part-time spinners has been a big positive that has come out of the on-going ODI series in South Africa

image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma and M Vijay celebrate the wicket of AB de Villiers, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, January 12, 2011

stories.title: Smith aims to win key moments
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth: Graeme Smith aims to win key moments
stories.summary: Weakness against spin, two collapses and losing the key moments - these are the key issues that have dogged South Africa in their last two ODI defeats against India

image.longCaption: India ended up winning by two wickets with 10 balls remaining, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, January 18, 2011

image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma and M Vijay celebrate the wicket of AB de Villiers, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, January 12, 2011

videos.title: Kepler Wessels: Duminy played a responsible innings
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
videos.summary: It's all to play for in the final game at Centurion, but South Africa might just sneak ahead with the advantage of home conditions

recentReportStory.title: Duminy stars in series-levelling win
recentReportStory.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth
recentReportStory.seoTitle: South Africa v India: JP Duminy stars in series-levelling win
recentReportStory.summary: JP Duminy orchestrated a fightback which hauled South Africa to a challenging total before India's batsmen, barring Virat Kohli, folded on a sluggish Port Elizabeth pitch

image.caption: Virat Kohli lofts on his way to a half-century
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli lofts on his way to a half-century, South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Port Elizabeth, January 21, 2011
